alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued October 14 at 3:12PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WIDESPREAD HEAVY RAIN TO IMPACT PANHANDLE TUESDAY TO THURSDAY... Ex Typhoon Bolaven will move into the Gulf of Alaska Tuesday morning, bringing widespread heavy rain with strong to high winds Tuesday afternoon through Thursday. While confidence on the exact track and extent of the extratropical cyclone remains below average, confidence of anomalously high precipitation and strong winds impacting the Panhandle is high. Main threats to the region include a rise in rivers, streams, and creeks beginning Tuesday night into Friday morning as the long duration rainfall event moves over Southeast Alaska. Strong winds from this land falling extratropical cyclone combined with saturated soils will also bring concerns for tree falls, mainly along river banks at this time. Care should be taken now to test bilge pumps and make vessels ready for long periods of heavy rain. This is a evolving and changing situation. Stay tuned the National Weather Service for updates at weather.gov/Juneau and on social media.
